titleInfo.title: Camp Evan Shelby Thanksgiving 1933 Menu and Roster

subject.topic: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- Officials and employees -- History -- 20th century
Tennessee Valley Authority and "grass roots democracy" .

subject.geographic: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).

mods.note: This souvenir program is for the Thanksgiving dinner in 1933 of Company 1473, Camp Evan Shelby, of the Civilian Conservation Corps in Bristol, Tennessee. The menu shows a traditional turkey dinner with sweet potatoes and pumpkin pie among the selections of vegetables and desserts. The menu also lists cigars, cigarettes and mints. The program contains a roster of the officers, leaders and members of Company 1473.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
